MOV.description:
Move data from second operand to the first one.

Both operands have to be in the internal RAM.

MOVC.description:
Move a byte from specified address into the Accumulator.

Address of code is calculated by adding value stored in the Accumulator and either DPTR or PC.

PC is incremented before adding.

MOVX.detail: Move between external memory and the accumulator
MOVX.description:
Move between external memory and the accumulator.

Uses either 8 bit or 16 bit address to external memory.

PUSH.description: Increments the Stack Pointer and copies value stored under provided internal RAM address to memory pointed by the stack pointer.

POP.description: Stores value pointed to by the Stack Pointer in under the provided internal RAM address and then decrements the Stack Pointer.

XCH.description: Stores a value of the Accumulator in a second operand and stores a value of the second operand in the Accumulator.

XCHD.description:
Stores a lower nibble (bits 0-3) of the Accumulator in a second operand and stores a lower nibble of the second operand in the Accumulator.

Operation exchanges lower nibbles of both values (bits 0-3). 

It does not affect higher nibbles (bit 4-7).
